text:
Hi all,

I’m looking to get information about this script hs/hsstatic/HubSpotToolsMenu/static-1.79/js/index.js

The support told me:
>  this controls whether we show the tool menu on the top right of the page (which a user will see if they are logged into the portal that owns the page).
If i well understand, this script is only usable on HubSpot environment right ?
I am digging in a website, hosted outside HubSpot, that use this script in website code. This seems not working and create a console error in chrome.

Reminder: Welcome to our developer community. If someone helps you out by answering a question. please pay it forward by helping someone else out in the community - when you know an answer. Ask questions in the relevant channels, our community is very active and will see it. We have a chatbot that can answer commonly asked questions, feel free to reach out to it by DMing `@DevHelp`

Hey <@U03DR5WV95H>! That’s correct. It’s this menu that quick links you to HubSpot tools, so it wouldn’t function on a page not hosted in HubSpot. It checks for the account hosting the page, and then if you’re signed into that account.

If the page isn’t HubSpot-hosted, it’s likely safe to remove.
